data.title: SiteGround Review
data.meta_description: I think it’s pretty fair to say that Siteground is one of the main and leading hosting companies, especially when it comes to WordPress websites, e-Commerce websites and most of...
data.text:
Shared hosting is the most basic plan you can order with hosting companies. With that said, most of the websites being created as we speak, have no reason to choose a more elaborate program. Siteground’s shared hosting program is no different. They have 3 separate plans of shared hosting, this is what they entail:

StartUp

The startup plan is a “slim plan” and is good for hosting one domain only. Although it’s a lot, you can host only up till 10GB and bandwidth is up to 10k visitors per month on this plan.

Blogs, business websites, small eCommerce websites – these can all fit in very well with the Startup plan.

Here is a list of what you get with all shared hosting plans:

Free Website Builder – not relevant for most users but you should know that it exists

cPanel & SSH Access

Free Setup & Transfer – this is great for the non savvy users among you

24/7 Technical Support

SSD Storage – meaning the hosting is really fast (important for user experience and SEO)

Free Daily Backup

30 Days Money Back

Unlimited Emails & Databases

Free Let’s Encrypt SSLs – useful if you want to create an https website

Free Cloudflare CDN – another feature which is great for speed

GrowBig

There are a few differences here. Here you can host multiple domains and not just one. You have 20GB hosting instead of 10 and 25K monthly users instead of 10k.

Besides these differences, here are a few additions that this plan gets:

Premium support – your tickets will be answered faster. Sort of a hosting VIP plan

Premium Speed – Siteground adds their SuperCacher here, to give you another speed boost

30 Backups – Siteground keeps 30 daily backups of your site

Great for WordPress & Joomla! – Siteground’s caching system is built specifically for these in mind

GoGeek

30 GB storage

Up to 100,000 monthly visits

This plan is great if you need a server with much more resources, such as a WooCommerce website with lots of products or variations or if you have lots of traffic and need the extra bandwidth.

The big plus here is that the Gogeek shared hosting plan has fewer accounts using the server.

If you are interested in Cloud hosting or in Siteground’s cloud hosting to be exact, you probably don’t need any introduction to what cloud is or how you can use it to your advantage. The prices of cloud hosting, no matter what company you are talking about, make sure that only someone who really needs it, signs up for it.

Siteground’s cloud platform is really fast and really powerful. You might be interested in the cloud plan if you are developing a web app that has some specific needs or you may run a super heavy in users and traffic website. These types of websites would fit in the cloud platform excellently.
